strings.Value: "You can return to Trobold and live there."
"Where will you go?"
"So be it, you can leave. But we meet again, I won't grant you mercy a second time."
[Attack] "Sparing Hargulka was my mistake. Any mercy to your kind means the death of more of my people."
[Attack] "The King of Pitax will pit you against his neighbors — probably, against me as well. I cannot allow you to go there."
[Attack] "I spared Hargulka because I was feeling merciful. Now my mood's more… bloodthirsty."
"Ha ha! Not bad!"
"That's cruel, Regongar. They ask for mercy, and you decide to finish them with another horrific pun?"
[Say nothing]
"Killed Kargadd, killed his children! Enemy of all trolls! Charge borba, tear borba apart!"
"Hey! Look there, everyone! I know that borba! That's mighty and strong one! Came to {g|Trobold}Trobold{/g}, killed many-many trolls, we had to run!"
"This borba killed King Hargulka — easily, like smashing a hare! Strong borba! Scary like fire! Run for your life!"
"We know — borba spared King Hargulka. Spare us too! These borba lands, no life for us here. We leave, not return!"
"We thank you, borba! You'll see us no more again!"
"RrrrrRRRR! Smash borba! Rip borba to pieces!"
"No, borba. Trolls not like you, not like kobolds. Life here… life in kingdom... not our way. Tartuk smart, but idea of {g|Trobold}Trobold{/g}… not."
"{g|Pitax}Pitax{/g}. We heard great borba king welcome trolls there, give shelter, sheep and cattle to eat. We go there, never return!"
{n}Ekun shakes his head.{/n} "When there's life for them, there's no life for humans."
"Right! Today's a great day to burn someone's hide off!"
"Mercy is a virtue to the weak, but a vice to the strong. You'd do well to remember that."
"You're right, of course. They're monsters... but let them go. It's wrong to kill someone who seeks mercy."
"What a pathetic bunch. You know what they say — don't ask... for whom the bell trolls! Ha ha ha!"
{n}A smug smirk spreads on the half-orc's face.{/n}
"Heh heh! Well, not like you keep me in your gang to be merciful, right?"
{n}Realizing no one is laughing at his joke, the half-orc spits on the ground, vexed.{/n}
